intro: Eremostachys labiosa f. flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered eremostachys, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and compact growth habit. The leaves are typically thick and fleshy, adapted for water storage, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The distinguishing feature of this form is its yellowish-pink floral display, which contrasts with the more typical pink or purple flowers of the species. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry conditions.
